pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:0.4.eng: The third training rule on expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ anekapariyāyena asubhakathaṃ katheti, asubhāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, asubhabhāvanāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa asubhasamāpattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.2.eng: At that time the Buddha spoke to the monks in many ways about unattractiveness—he spoke in praise of unattractiveness, of developing the mind in unattractiveness, and of the attainment of unattractiveness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.3.eng: The Buddha then addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.4.eng: “Monks, I wish to go into solitary retreat for half a month.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.5.pli: Namhi kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.5.eng: No one should visit me except the one who brings me almsfood.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti, kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā nāssudha koci bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamati, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.7.pli: Bhikkhū—“bhagavā kho anekapariyāyena asubhakathaṃ katheti, asubhāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, asubhabhāvanāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa asubhasamāpattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsatī”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.7.eng: Soon afterwards the monks reflected that the Buddha had praised unattractiveness in many ways,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.8.eng: and they devoted themselves to developing the mind in unattractiveness in its many different facets.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.9.pli: Te sakena kāyena aṭṭīyanti harāyanti jigucchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.9.eng: As a consequence, they became troubled by their own bodies, ashamed of and disgusted with them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.10.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.10.eng: Just as a young woman or man—someone fond of adornments, with freshly washed hair—would be ashamed, humiliated, and disgusted if the carcass of a snake, dog, or man was hung around her neck,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.11.pli: evameva te bhikkhū sakena kāyena aṭṭīyantā harāyantā jigucchantā
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.11.eng: just so those monks were troubled by their own bodies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.12.pli: attanāpi attānaṃ jīvitā voropenti, aññamaññampi jīvitā voropenti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.12.eng: They took their own lives, took the lives of one another,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.13.eng: and they went to Migalaṇḍika, the monastic lookalike, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.15.eng: You will get our bowl and robes.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.16.pli: Atha kho migalaṇḍiko samaṇakuttako pattacīvarehi bhaṭo sambahule bhikkhū jīvitā voropetvā lohitakaṃ asiṃ ādāya yena vaggumudā nadī tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.16.eng: And hired for a bowl and robes, Migalaṇḍika killed a number of monks. He then took his blood-stained knife to the river Vaggumudā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.17.pli: Atha kho migalaṇḍikassa samaṇakuttakassa lohitakaṃ taṃ asiṃ dhovantassa ahudeva kukkuccaṃ ahu vippaṭisāro—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.17.eng: While washing it, he became anxious and remorseful, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.18.pli: “alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.19.pli: Bahuṃ vata mayā apuññaṃ pasutaṃ, yohaṃ bhikkhū sīlavante kalyāṇadhamme jīvitā voropesin”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.19.eng: I’ve made so much demerit by killing good monks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.20.pli: Atha kho aññatarā mārakāyikā devatā abhijjamāne udake āgantvā migalaṇḍikaṃ samaṇakuttakaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.20.eng: Then a god from the realm of the Lord of Death, coming across the water, said to Migalaṇḍika,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.21.pli: “sādhu sādhu, sappurisa, lābhā te, sappurisa, suladdhaṃ te, sappurisa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.21.eng: “Well done, superior man, you’re truly fortunate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.22.pli: Bahuṃ tayā, sappurisa, puññaṃ pasutaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ atiṇṇe tāresī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.22.eng: You’ve made much merit by helping across those who hadn’t yet crossed.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.24.pli: “lābhā kira me, suladdhaṃ kira me, bahuṃ kira mayā puññaṃ pasutaṃ, atiṇṇe kirāhaṃ tāremī”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.24.eng: “So it seems that I’m fortunate, that I’ve made much merit!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.25.pli: tiṇhaṃ asiṃ ādāya vihārena vihāraṃ pariveṇena pariveṇaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.25.eng: He then went from dwelling to dwelling, from yard to yard, and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.25.comm: “Yard” renders pariveṇa. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.26.eng: “Who hasn’t crossed yet? Who can I help across?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.27.pli: Tattha ye te bhikkhū avītarāgā tesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye hotiyeva bhayaṃ hoti chambhitattaṃ hoti lomahaṃso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.27.eng: The monks who still had worldly attachments became fearful and terrified, with goosebumps all over.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.28.pli: Ye pana te bhikkhū vītarāgā tesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye na hoti bhayaṃ na hoti chambhitattaṃ na hoti lomahaṃso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.28.eng: Only those who were free from worldly attachments were unaffected.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.29.pli: Atha kho migalaṇḍiko samaṇakuttako ekampi bhikkhuṃ ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, dvepi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, tayopi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, cattāropi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, pañcapi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, dasapi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, vīsampi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, tiṃsampi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, cattālīsampi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, paññāsampi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi, saṭṭhimpi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.29.eng: Then, on a single day, Migalaṇḍika killed one monk, two monks, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, even sixty monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassa addhamāsassa accayena paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.1.eng: At the end of that half-month, when the Buddha came out of seclusion, he said to Venerable Ānanda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.2.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, ānanda, tanubhūto viya bhikkhusaṅgho”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.2.eng: “Ānanda, why is the Sangha of monks so reduced?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.3.pli: “Tathā hi pana, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ anekapariyāyena asubhakathaṃ katheti, asubhāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, asubhabhāvanāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa asubhasamāpattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.3.eng: Ānanda told him what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.4.pli: Te ca, bhante, bhikkhū— ‘bhagavā kho anekapariyāyena asubhakathaṃ katheti, asubhāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, asubhabhāvanāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa asubhasamāpattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsatī’ti, te anekākāravokāraṃ asubhabhāvanānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.5.pli: Te sakena kāyena aṭṭīyanti harāyanti jigucchanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.6.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.7.pli: evameva te bhikkhū sakena kāyena aṭṭīyantā harāyantā jigucchantā

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.8.pli: attanāpi attānaṃ jīvitā voropenti, aññamaññampi jīvitā voropenti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.12.pli: Atha kho, bhante, migalaṇḍiko samaṇakuttako pattacīvarehi bhaṭo ekampi bhikkhuṃ ekāhena jīvitā voropesi …pe… saṭṭhimpi bhikkhū ekāhena jīvitā voropesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.13.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā aññaṃ pariyāyaṃ ācikkhatu yathāyaṃ bhikkhusaṅgho aññāya saṇṭhaheyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.13.eng: adding, “Please give another instruction, sir, for the Sangha of monks to become established in perfect insight.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.14.pli: “Tenahānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṃ upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannipātehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.14.eng: “Well then, Ānanda, bring together in the assembly hall all the monks who live supported by Vesālī.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.16.pli: kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṃ upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannipātetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.16.eng: When he had done so, he went to the Buddha and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.17.eng: “Sir, the Sangha of monks is gathered.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.18.eng: Please do as you think appropriate.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.19.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena upaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.2.19.eng: The Buddha then went to the assembly hall, sat down on the prepared seat, and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.1.pli: “Ayampi kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.1.eng: “Monks, when stillness by mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated, it is peaceful and sublime, and a satisfying state of bliss. And it removes bad and unwholesome qualities on the spot, whenever they arise.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse uhataṃ rajojallaṃ tamenaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.2.eng: Just as a great, unseasonal storm in the last month of summer removes the dust and dirt from the air,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.3.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.3.eng: just so, when stillness by mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated, it is peaceful and sublime, and it removes bad and unwholesome qualities on the spot, whenever they arise.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.4.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvito ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi kathaṃ bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.4.eng: And how is stillness by mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated in this way?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.5.eng: A monk sits down in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty hut. He crosses his legs, straightens his body, and sets up mindfulness in front of him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.6.eng: Simply mindful, he breathes in; mindful, he breathes out.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.7.pli: Dīghaṃ vā assasanto dīghaṃ assasāmīti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto dīghaṃ passasāmīti pajānāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.7.eng: When he breathes in long, he knows it; and when he breathes out long, he knows that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.8.pli: Rassaṃ vā assasanto rassaṃ assasāmīti pajānāti, rassaṃ vā passasanto rassaṃ passasāmīti pajānāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.8.eng: When he breathes in short, he knows it; and when he breathes out short, he knows that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.9.pli: Sabbakāyappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmīti sikkhati. Sabbakāyappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.9.eng: When breathing in, he trains in fully experiencing the breath; when breathing out, he trains in fully experiencing the breath.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.9.comm: I have here translated kāya as breath in accordance with the usage in the Ānāpānasati Sutta (MN 118:24.6) where the breath is specifically said to be a body among bodies. Sp 1.165: Sakalassa assāsakāyassa ādimajjhapariyosānaṁ viditaṁ karonto pākaṭaṁ karonto “assasissāmī”ti sikkhati, “He trains, ‘I will breathe in’, producing knowledge of and familiarity with the beginning, the middle, and the end of the whole body of the breath.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.10.pli: Passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmīti sikkhati. Passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.10.eng: When breathing in, he trains in calming the activity of the body; when breathing out, he trains in calming the activity of the body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.11.pli: Pītippaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmīti sikkhati. Pītippaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.11.eng: When breathing in, he trains in experiencing joy; when breathing out, he trains in experiencing joy.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.12.pli: Sukhappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmīti sikkhati. Sukhappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.12.eng: When breathing in, he trains in experiencing bliss; when breathing out, he trains in experiencing bliss.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.13.pli: Cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmīti sikkhati. Cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.13.eng: When breathing in, he trains in experiencing the activity of the mind; when breathing out, he trains in experiencing the activity of the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.14.pli: Passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmīti sikkhati. Passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.14.eng: When breathing in, he trains in calming the activity of the mind; when breathing out, he trains in calming the activity of the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.15.pli: Cittappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmīti sikkhati. Cittappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.15.eng: When breathing in, he trains in experiencing the mind; when breathing out, he trains in experiencing the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.16.eng: When breathing in, he trains in gladdening the mind; when breathing out, he trains in gladdening the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.17.eng: When breathing in, he trains in stilling the mind; when breathing out, he trains in stilling the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.18.eng: When breathing in, he trains in freeing the mind; when breathing out, he trains in freeing the mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.19.eng: When breathing in, he trains in contemplating impermanence; when breathing out, he trains in contemplating impermanence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.20.eng: When breathing in, he trains in contemplating fading away; when breathing out, he trains in contemplating fading away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.21.eng: When breathing in, he trains in contemplating ending; when breathing out, he trains in contemplating ending.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.22.pli: paṭinissaggānupassī assasissāmīti sikkhati. Paṭinissaggānupassī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.22.eng: When breathing in, he trains in contemplating relinquishment; when breathing out, he trains in contemplating relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.23.pli: Evaṃ bhāvito kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi evaṃ bahulīkato santo ceva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppannuppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasametī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.3.23.eng: Monks, when stillness by mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated like this, it is peaceful and sublime, and a satisfying state of bliss. And it removes bad and unwholesome qualities on the spot, whenever they arise.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.1.eng: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.2.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū attanāpi attānaṃ jīvitā voropenti, aññamaññampi jīvitā voropenti migalaṇḍikampi samaṇakuttakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.2.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who have taken their own lives, who have killed one another, and who have said to Migalaṇḍika,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.3.pli: ‘sādhu no, āvuso, jīvitā voropehi, idaṃ te pattacīvaraṃ bhavissatī’”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.3.eng: ‘Please kill us. You will get our bowl and robes’?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.6.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ananulomikaṃ appaṭirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.6.eng: “Monks, it’s not suitable for these monks, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.7.pli: Kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū attanāpi attānaṃ jīvitā voropessanti, aññamaññampi jīvitā voropessanti, migalaṇḍikampi samaṇakuttakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vakkhanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.7.eng: How could those monks do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.8.pli: ‘sādhu no, āvuso, jīvitā voropehi, idaṃ te pattacīvaraṃ bhavissatī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.10.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.11.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya satthahārakaṃ vāssa pariyeseyya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.12.eng: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.1.eng: At one time a certain lay follower was sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.2.pli: Tassa pajāpati abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.2.eng: He had a beautiful and pleasant wife,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tassā itthiyā paṭibaddhacittā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.3.eng: who the monks from the group of six had fallen in love with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.5.pli: “sace kho so, āvuso, upāsako jīvissati na mayaṃ taṃ itthiṃ labhissāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.5.eng: “If this lay follower recovers, we won’t get her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.6.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, tassa upāsakassa maraṇavaṇṇaṃ saṃvaṇṇemā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.6.eng: Come, let’s praise death to him.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.7.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yena so upāsako tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ upāsakaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.7.eng: They then went to that lay follower and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.8.pli: “tvaṃ khosi, upāsaka, katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo akatapāpo akataluddo akatakibbiso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.8.eng: “You’ve done what’s good and wholesome; you’ve made a shelter against fear. You haven’t done anything bad; you haven’t been greedy or immoral.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.9.pli: Kataṃ tayā kalyāṇaṃ, akataṃ tayā pāpaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.10.eng: So why carry on with this miserable and difficult life?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.12.pli: Ito tvaṃ kālaṅkato kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.12.eng: When you’ve passed away, you’ll be reborn in a happy place, in heaven.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.13.pli: Tattha dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāressasī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.13.eng: There you’ll be able to enjoy the pleasures of heaven.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.16.pli: Ahañhi katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo akatapāpo akataluddo akatakibbiso.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.17.pli: Kataṃ mayā kalyāṇaṃ, akataṃ mayā pāpaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.17.eng: for I’ve done what’s good and avoided what’s bad,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.20.pli: Ito ahaṃ kālaṅkato kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.20.eng: and after death I’ll be reborn in a happy place.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.21.pli: Tattha dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāressāmī”ti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.22.pli: so asappāyāni ceva bhojanāni bhuñji asappāyāni ca khādanīyāni khādi asappāyāni ca sāyanīyāni sāyi asappāyāni ca pānāni pivi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.22.eng: From then on he ate various kinds of detrimental food and drank detrimental drinks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.23.pli: Tassa asappāyāni ceva bhojanāni bhuñjato asappāyāni ca khādanīyāni khādato asappāyāni ca sāyanīyāni sāyato asappāyāni ca pānāni pivato kharo ābādho uppajji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.23.eng: and as a consequence, he became very ill

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.25.eng: But his wife complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.26.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and immoral liars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.27.pli: Ime hi nāma dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā paṭijānissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.27.eng: They claim to have integrity, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and good.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.28.pli: Natthi imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ natthi imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.28.eng: But they don’t have the good character of a monastic or brahmin.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.29.pli: naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, kuto imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ kuto imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, apagatā ime sāmaññā apagatā ime brahmaññā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.30.eng: They praised death to my husband,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.31.eng: and as a result my husband is dead.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.32.eng: And other people complained and criticized them in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.34.pli: Ime hi nāma dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā paṭijānissanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.35.pli: Natthi imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ natthi imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, kuto imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ kuto imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, apagatā ime sāmaññā apagatā ime brahmaññā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.38.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.38.eng: The monks heard the criticism of those people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.39.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.39.eng: Those monks who had few desires and a sense of conscience, who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.40.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū upāsakassa maraṇavaṇṇaṃ saṃvaṇṇissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.40.eng: “How could they praise death to that lay follower?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.41.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.41.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.42.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, upāsakassa maraṇavaṇṇaṃ saṃvaṇṇethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.42.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.45.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisā, ananulomikaṃ appaṭirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.45.eng: “Foolish men, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.46.pli: Kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, upāsakassa maraṇavaṇṇaṃ saṃvaṇṇissatha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.48.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.48.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.49.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya satthahārakaṃ vāssa pariyeseyya maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya maraṇāya vā samādapeyya—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.49.1.eng: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for them or praises death or incites someone to die, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.49.1.comm: “An instrument of death” renders satthahāraka. I follow Richard Gombrich’s interpretation of this word. See “The Mass Suicide of Monks in Discourse and Vinaya Literature”, by Analayo, Journal of the Oxford Centre for Buddhist Studies, 7: 11–55, 2014.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.50.pli: ‘ambho purisa, kiṃ tuyhiminā pāpakena dujjīvitena, mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.50.eng: “My friend, what’s the point of this miserable and difficult life? Death is better for you than life!”—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.51.pli: iti cittamano cittasaṅkappo anekapariyāyena maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.51.eng: thinking and intending thus, if he praises death in many ways or incites someone to die—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.52.eng: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.6.eng: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, he transgresses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.8.pli: yaṃ mātukucchismiṃ paṭhamaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ paṭhamaṃ viññāṇaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, yāva maraṇakālā etthantare eso manussaviggaho nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.8.eng: from the mind’s first appearance in the mother’s womb, from the first manifestation of consciousness, until the time of death: in between these—this is called “a human being”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.10.eng: cuts off the life faculty, brings it to an end, interrupts its continuation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.11.eng: Or seeks an instrument of death for them:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.12.pli: asiṃ vā sattiṃ vā bheṇḍiṃ vā laguḷaṃ vā pāsāṇaṃ vā satthaṃ vā visaṃ vā rajjuṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.12.eng: a sword, a dagger, an arrow, a club, a rock, a knife, poison, or a rope.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.14.pli: jīvite ādīnavaṃ dasseti, maraṇe vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.14.eng: he shows the drawbacks of living and speaks in praise of death.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.16.pli: satthaṃ vā āhara, visaṃ vā khāda, rajjuyā vā ubbandhitvā kālaṃ karohīti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.16.eng: he says, “Kill yourself with a knife,” “Eat poison,” “Die by hanging yourself with a rope.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.18.eng: this is a form of address.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.19.eng: What’s the point of this miserable and difficult life:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.21.pli: aḍḍhānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya daliddānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ lāmakaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.21.eng: the life of the poor is miserable compared to the life of the rich;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.22.pli: sadhanānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya adhanānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.22.eng: the life of the impoverished is miserable compared to the life of the wealthy;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.23.pli: devānaṃ jīvitaṃ upādāya manussānaṃ jīvitaṃ pāpakaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.23.eng: the life of humans is miserable compared to the life of the gods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.25.pli: hatthacchinnassa pādacchinnassa hatthapādacchinnassa kaṇṇacchinnassa nāsacchinnassa kaṇṇanāsacchinnassa,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.25.eng: the life of one whose hands are cut off, whose feet are cut off, whose hands and feet are cut off, whose ears are cut off, whose nose is cut off, whose ears and nose are cut off.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.26.pli: iminā ca pāpakena iminā ca dujjīvitena mataṃ te jīvitā seyyoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.26.eng: Because of this sort of miserableness and this sort of difficult life, one says, “Death is better for you than life!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.28.pli: yaṃ cittaṃ taṃ mano, yaṃ mano taṃ cittaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.30.eng: perceiving death, intending death, aiming at death.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.34.pli: jīvite ādīnavaṃ dasseti, maraṇe vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.34.eng: he shows the drawbacks of living and speaks in praise of death, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.35.pli: “ito tvaṃ kālaṅkato kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissasi,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.35.eng: “When you’ve passed away, you’ll be reborn in a happy destination, in heaven.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.36.pli: tattha dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāressasī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.36.eng: There you’ll be able to enjoy the pleasures of heaven.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.38.pli: satthaṃ vā āhara, visaṃ vā khāda, rajjuyā vā ubbandhitvā kālaṃ karohi, sobbhe vā narake vā papāte vā papatāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.38.eng: he says, “Kill yourself with a knife,” “Eat poison,” “Die by hanging yourself with a rope,” “Jump into a chasm,” “Jump into a pit,” “Jump off a cliff.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.40.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.42.pli: seyyathāpi nāma puthusilā dvidhā bhinnā appaṭisandhikā hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.42.eng: just as an ordinary stone that has broken in half cannot be put back together again,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.43.pli: evameva bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropetvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.43.eng: so too is a monk who has intentionally killed a human being not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.44.eng: Therefore it is said, “he is expelled.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.46.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā— eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.46.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.47.pli: So tena saddhiṃ natthi, tena vuccati asaṃvāsoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.47.eng: He does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.1.pli: Sāmaṃ, adhiṭṭhāya, dūtena, dūtaparamparāya, visakkiyena dūtena, gatapaccāgatena dūtena,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.1.eng: Oneself, having made a determination, by messenger, by a series of messengers, by a messenger who does not follow instructions, by a messenger gone and returned again.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.2.eng: Not in private, but perceiving it as private.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.3.eng: In private, but perceiving it as not private.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.4.eng: Not in private, and perceiving it as not private.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.5.eng: In private, and perceiving it as private.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.6.eng: He praises by means of the body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.7.eng: He praises by means of speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.8.eng: He praises by means of both the body and speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.9.eng: He praises by means of a messenger.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.10.eng: He praises by means of writing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.11.pli: opātaṃ apassenaṃ, upanikkhipanaṃ, bhesajjaṃ, rūpūpahāro, saddūpahāro, gandhūpahāro, rasūpahāro, phoṭṭhabbūpahāro, dhammūpahāro, ācikkhanā, anusāsanī, saṅketakammaṃ, nimittakammanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.1.11.eng: A pit, a piece of furniture, placing near, tonic, arranging a sight, arranging a sound, arranging a smell, arranging a taste, arranging a touch, arranging a mental quality, information, instruction, acting by arrangement, making a sign.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.2.pli: sayaṃ hanati kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.2.eng: one oneself kills by means of the body or by means of something connected to the body or by means of something released.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.4.1.pli: adhiṭṭhahitvā āṇāpeti— “evaṃ vijjha, evaṃ pahara, evaṃ ghātehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.4.1.eng: having made a determination, he tells someone, “Hit thus, strike thus, kill thus.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.5.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.5.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.6.pli: So taṃ maññamāno taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.6.eng: If the second monk kills that person, thinking it is the one he was told to kill, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.7.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.7.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.8.pli: So taṃ maññamāno aññaṃ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti. Vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.8.eng: If the second monk kills another person, thinking it is the one he was told to kill, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.9.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.9.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.10.pli: So aññaṃ maññamāno taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.10.eng: If the second monk kills that person, thinking it is someone other than the one he was told to kill, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.11.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.11.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.12.1.pli: So aññaṃ maññamāno aññaṃ jīvitā voropeti; mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti, vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.12.1.eng: If the second monk kills another person, thinking it is someone other than the one he was told to kill, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.13.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmassa pāvada—‘itthannāmo itthannāmassa pāvadatu—itthannāmo itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropetū’”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.13.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Tell so-and-so to tell so-and-so to kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.14.eng: In telling the next person, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.15.eng: If the potential murderer agrees, there is a serious offense for the instigator.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.16.1.pli: So taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti sabbesaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.16.1.eng: If he kills that person, there is an offense entailing expulsion for all of them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.16.2.eng: By a messenger who does not follow instructions:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.17.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmassa pāvada—‘itthannāmo itthannāmassa pāvadatu—itthannāmo itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropetū’”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.17.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Tell so-and-so to tell so-and-so to kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.18.eng: If the other monk tells another person than the one he was told to tell, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.19.eng: If the potential murderer agrees, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.20.pli: So taṃ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.20.eng: If he kills that person, there is no offense for the instigator,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.21.1.pli: āṇāpakassa ca vadhakassa ca āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.21.1.eng: but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the messenger and for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.21.2.eng: By a messenger gone and returned again:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.22.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.22.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.23.pli: So gantvā puna paccāgacchati— “nāhaṃ sakkomi taṃ jīvitā voropetun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.23.eng: He goes, but returns, saying, “I wasn’t able to kill them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.24.pli: So puna āṇāpeti— “yadā sakkosi tadā taṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.24.eng: If the first monk tells him again, “When you’re able, then kill them,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.25.pli: So taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.25.eng: If the second monk kills that person, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.26.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.26.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.27.pli: So āṇāpetvā vippaṭisārī na sāveti— “mā ghātehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.27.eng: He then regrets it, but does not say, “Don’t kill them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.28.pli: So taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.28.eng: If the second monk then kills that person, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.29.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.29.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.30.eng: He then regrets it and says, “Don’t kill them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.31.pli: So—“āṇatto ahaṃ tayā”ti taṃ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti. Vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.31.eng: If the second monk replies, “I’ve been told by you to do so,” and then kills that person, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.32.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmaṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.32.eng: If a monk tells a second monk, “Kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.33.eng: He then regrets it and says, “Don’t kill them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.34.eng: If the second monk replies, “Fine,” and desists, there is no offense for either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.1.eng: Not in private, but perceiving it as private:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.2.pli: ullapati— “aho itthannāmo hato assā”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.2.eng: if he says aloud, “I wish so-and-so was killed,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.3.eng: In private, but perceiving it as not private:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.4.pli: ullapati— “aho itthannāmo hato assā”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.4.eng: if he says aloud, “I wish so-and-so was killed,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.5.eng: Not in private, and perceiving it as not private:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.6.pli: ullapati— “aho itthannāmo hato assā”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.6.eng: if he says aloud, “I wish so-and-so was killed,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.7.eng: In private, and perceiving it as private:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.8.pli: ullapati— “aho itthannāmo hato assā”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.3.8.eng: if he says aloud, “I wish so-and-so was killed,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.1.eng: He praises by means of the body:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.2.pli: kāyena vikāraṃ karoti— “yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.2.eng: if a monk makes a gesture with the body, indicating, “Whoever dies thus, receives wealth,” or, “Whoever dies thus, becomes famous,” or, “Whoever dies thus, goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.3.pli: Tāya saṃvaṇṇanāya marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.3.eng: If, because of that praise, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.5.eng: He praises by means of speech:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.6.pli: vācāya bhaṇati— “yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.6.eng: if a monk says, “Whoever dies thus, receives wealth,” or, “Whoever dies thus, becomes famous,” or, “Whoever dies thus, goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.7.pli: Tāya saṃvaṇṇanāya marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.7.eng: If, because of that praise, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.8.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.9.eng: He praises by means of the body and speech:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.10.pli: kāyena ca vikāraṃ karoti, vācāya ca bhaṇati— “yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.10.eng: if a monk makes a gesture with the body and says, “Whoever dies thus, receives wealth,” or, “Whoever dies thus, becomes famous,” or, “Whoever dies thus, goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.11.pli: Tāya saṃvaṇṇanāya marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.11.eng: If, because of that praise, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.12.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.13.eng: He praises by means of a messenger:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.14.pli: dūtassa sāsanaṃ āroceti— “yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.14.eng: if a monk gives instructions to a messenger, saying, “Whoever dies thus, receives wealth,” or, “Whoever dies thus, becomes famous,” or, “Whoever dies thus, goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.15.pli: Dūtassa sāsanaṃ sutvā marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.15.eng: If, after hearing the messenger’s instruction, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.16.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.17.eng: He praises by means of writing:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.18.pli: lekhaṃ chindati— “yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, akkharakkharāya āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.18.eng: if a monk writes, “Whoever dies thus, receives wealth,” or, “Whoever dies thus, becomes famous,” or, “Whoever dies thus, goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct for each character he writes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.19.pli: Lekhaṃ passitvā marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.19.eng: If, after seeing the writing, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.4.20.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.2.pli: manussaṃ uddissa opātaṃ khanati— “papatitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.2.eng: if a monk digs a pit for a human being, thinking, “Falling into it, they will die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.3.pli: Papatite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.3.eng: If a person falls into it and experiences pain, the monk commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.3.comm: Sp 1.176: Yaṁ uddissa khanati, tassa dukkhuppattiyā thullaccayaṁ, maraṇena pārājikaṁ. Aññasmiṁ patitvā mate anāpatti, “If the person he dug the pit for experiences pain, there is a serious offense. If he dies, there is an offense entailing expulsion. If someone else falls in and dies, there is no offense.” The commentary makes a point that goes beyond what is found in the Canonical text. According to the Canonical text, if you dig a pit for any human being to fall into, then the offense occurs when any human being falls into it. The commentary, however, makes the additional point that if you dig a pit for a specific human to fall into, you only commit an offense if that same human being falls into it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.5.pli: Anodissa opātaṃ khanati— “yo koci papatitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.5.eng: If a monk digs a non-specific pit, thinking, “Whatever falls into it, will die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.5.comm: Sp 1.176: Sace anuddissa “yo koci marissatī”ti khato hoti, yattakā patitvā maranti, tattakā pāṇātipātā, “If it is not dug for a specific person or being, but with the thought, ‘Whatever dies’, then, to the extent that a being falls in and dies, there is killing.” And therefore an offense entailing expulsion if that being is human.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.6.eng: If a person falls into it, the monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.7.pli: Papatite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.7.eng: If they experience pain after falling in, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.8.eng: If they die, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.9.pli: Yakkho vā peto vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggaho vā tasmiṃ papatati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.9.eng: If a spirit, ghost, or animal in human form falls into it, the monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.9.comm: Kkh-pṭ: Manussaviggaho nāgasupaṇṇādisadiso tiracchānagato tiracchānagatamanussaviggaho, “Tiracchānagatamanussaviggaha: an animal like a dragon or a garuda, etc., in human form.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.10.pli: Papatite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.10.eng: If it experiences pain after falling in, the monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.11.eng: If it dies, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.12.eng: If an animal falls into it, the monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.13.pli: Papatite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.13.eng: If it experiences pain after falling in, the monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.5.14.eng: If it dies, the monk commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.6.2.pli: apassene satthaṃ vā ṭhapeti visena vā makkheti dubbalaṃ vā karoti sobbhe vā narake vā papāte vā ṭhapeti— “papatitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.6.2.eng: if a monk places a dagger in a piece of furniture, smears the furniture with poison, or makes it weak, or if he places it near a lake, a pit, or a cliff, thinking, “Falling down, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.6.3.pli: Satthena vā visena vā papatitena vā dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.6.3.eng: If the target person experiences pain because of the dagger, the poison, or the fall, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.6.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.7.2.pli: asiṃ vā sattiṃ vā bheṇḍiṃ vā laguḷaṃ vā pāsāṇaṃ vā satthaṃ vā visaṃ vā rajjuṃ vā upanikkhipati— “iminā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.7.2.eng: if a monk places a knife, a dagger, an arrow, a club, a rock, a sword, poison, or a rope near a person, thinking, “Using this, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.7.3.pli: “Tena marissāmī”ti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.7.3.eng: If the target person thinks, “Using that, I shall die,” and he does something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.7.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.8.2.pli: sappiṃ vā navanītaṃ vā telaṃ vā madhuṃ vā phāṇitaṃ vā deti— “imaṃ sāyitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.8.2.eng: if a monk gives a person ghee, butter, oil, honey, or syrup, thinking, “After tasting this, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.8.2.comm: “Syrup” renders phāṇita. I. B. Horner instead translates it as “molasses”, which doesn’t quite hit the mark. SED defines phāṇita as “the inspissated juice of the sugarcane or other plants”, in other words, “cane syrup”. According to the commentary at Sp 1.623 it can be either cooked or uncooked, the difference presumably whether it is raw or concentrated. “Syrup” seems closer to the mark than “molasses”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.8.3.pli: Taṃ sāyite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.8.3.eng: If the target person tastes it and experiences pain, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.8.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.2.pli: amanāpikaṃ rūpaṃ upasaṃharati bhayānakaṃ bheravaṃ— “imaṃ passitvā uttasitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.2.eng: if a monk arranges a dreadful and terrifying sight, thinking, “Seeing this and becoming terrified, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.3.eng: If the target person sees it and becomes terrified, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.5.pli: Manāpikaṃ rūpaṃ upasaṃharati— “imaṃ passitvā alābhakena sussitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.5.eng: If a monk arranges a lovely sight, thinking, “Seeing this and then being unable to get hold of it, they’ll wither and die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.6.pli: Taṃ passitvā alābhakena sussati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.6.eng: If the target person sees it and then withers because of not getting hold of it, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.7.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.9.pli: amanāpikaṃ saddaṃ upasaṃharati bhayānakaṃ bheravaṃ— “imaṃ sutvā uttasitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.9.eng: if a monk arranges a dreadful and terrifying sound, thinking, “Hearing this and becoming terrified, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.10.eng: If the target person hears it and becomes terrified, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.11.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.12.pli: Manāpikaṃ saddaṃ upasaṃharati pemanīyaṃ hadayaṅgamaṃ— “imaṃ sutvā alābhakena sussitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.12.eng: If a monk arranges a lovely and heart-stirring sound, thinking, “Hearing this and then being unable to get hold of it, they’ll wither and die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.13.pli: Taṃ sutvā alābhakena sussati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.13.eng: If the target person hears it and then withers because of not getting hold of it, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.14.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.16.pli: amanāpikaṃ gandhaṃ upasaṃharati jegucchaṃ pāṭikulyaṃ— “imaṃ ghāyitvā jegucchatā pāṭikulyatā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.16.eng: if a monk arranges a disgusting and repulsive smell, thinking, “Smelling this, they’ll die from disgust and repulsion,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.17.pli: Taṃ ghāyite jegucchatā pāṭikulyatā dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.17.eng: If the target person smells it and experiences suffering because of disgust and revulsion, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.18.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.19.pli: Manāpikaṃ gandhaṃ upasaṃharati— “imaṃ ghāyitvā alābhakena sussitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.19.eng: If a monk arranges a fragrant scent, thinking, “Smelling this and then being unable to get hold of it, they’ll wither and die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.20.pli: Taṃ ghāyitvā alābhakena sussati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.20.eng: If the target person smells it and then withers because of not getting hold of it, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.21.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.23.pli: amanāpikaṃ rasaṃ upasaṃharati jegucchaṃ pāṭikulyaṃ— “imaṃ sāyitvā jegucchatā pāṭikulyatā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.23.eng: if a monk arranges a disgusting and repulsive flavor, thinking, “Tasting this, they’ll die from disgust and repulsion,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.24.pli: Taṃ sāyite jegucchatā pāṭikulyatā dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.24.eng: If the target person tastes it and experiences suffering because of disgust and repulsion, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.25.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.26.pli: Manāpikaṃ rasaṃ upasaṃharati— “imaṃ sāyitvā alābhakena sussitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.26.eng: If a monk arranges a delicious flavor, thinking, “Tasting this and then being unable to get hold of it, they’ll wither and die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.27.pli: Taṃ sāyitvā alābhakena sussati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.27.eng: If the target person tastes it and then withers because of not getting hold of it, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.28.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.30.pli: amanāpikaṃ phoṭṭhabbaṃ upasaṃharati dukkhasamphassaṃ kharasamphassaṃ— “iminā phuṭṭho marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.30.eng: if a monk arranges a painful and harsh physical contact, thinking, “Touched by this, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.31.pli: Tena phuṭṭhassa dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.31.eng: If the target person makes contact with it and experiences pain, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.32.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.33.pli: Manāpikaṃ phoṭṭhabbaṃ upasaṃharati sukhasamphassaṃ mudusamphassaṃ— “iminā phuṭṭho alābhakena sussitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.33.eng: If a monk arranges a pleasant and soft physical contact, thinking, “Touched by this and then being unable to get hold of it, they’ll wither and die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.34.pli: Tena phuṭṭho alābhakena sussati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.34.eng: If the target person is touched by it and then withers because of not getting hold of it, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.35.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.37.pli: nerayikassa nirayakathaṃ katheti— “imaṃ sutvā uttasitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.37.eng: if a monk talks about hell to someone bound for hell, thinking, “Hearing this and becoming terrified, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.38.eng: If the target person hears it and becomes terrified, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.39.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.40.pli: Kalyāṇakammassa saggakathaṃ katheti— “imaṃ sutvā adhimutto marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.40.eng: If a monk talks about heaven to someone of good behavior, thinking, “Hearing this and being keen on it, they’ll die,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.41.pli: Taṃ sutvā adhimutto marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.41.eng: If the target person hears it, becomes keen on it, and thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.9.42.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.2.pli: puṭṭho bhaṇati— “evaṃ marassu. Yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.2.eng: if, being asked, a monk says, “Die like this. Anyone who does receives wealth,” or, “Die like this. Anyone who does becomes famous,” or, “Die like this. Anyone who does goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.3.pli: Tāya ācikkhanāya marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.3.eng: If, because of that information, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.4.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.6.pli: apuṭṭho bhaṇati— “evaṃ marassu. Yo evaṃ marati so dhanaṃ vā labhati yasaṃ vā labhati saggaṃ vā gacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.6.eng: if, without being asked, a monk says, “Die like this. Anyone who does receives wealth,” or, “Die like this. Anyone who does becomes famous,” or, “Die like this. Anyone who does goes to heaven,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.7.pli: Tāya anusāsaniyā marissāmīti dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ uppādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.7.eng: If, because of that instruction, the target person thinks, “I shall die,” and they do something painful, the monk commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.8.eng: If the person dies, the monk commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.10.pli: saṅketaṃ karoti purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā rattiṃ vā divā vā— “tena saṅketena taṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.10.eng: if a monk makes an arrangement for before the meal or for after the meal, for the night or for the day, telling another person, “Kill that person according to this arrangement,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.11.pli: Tena saṅketena taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.11.eng: If the other person kills that person according to that arrangement, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.12.pli: Taṃ saṅketaṃ pure vā pacchā vā taṃ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti, vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.12.eng: If he kills him before or after the time of the arrangement, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.14.pli: nimittaṃ karoti— “akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇissāmi bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipissāmi sīsaṃ vā ukkhipissāmi, tena nimittena taṃ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.14.eng: a monk makes a sign. If he says to another person, “When I wink, at that sign kill that person,” “When I raise an eyebrow, at that sign kill that person,” or, “When I nod, at that sign kill that person,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.15.pli: Tena nimittena taṃ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṃ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.15.eng: If, at that sign, the other person kills that person, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.16.pli: Taṃ nimittaṃ pure vā pacchā vā taṃ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti, vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.16.eng: If he kills him before or after the sign, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.4.eng: if he is not aiming at death;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.7.eng: The first section for recitation on expulsion in relation to human beings is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.11.eng: Gone forth when old, flowing out,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.16.eng: An elevated platform, coming down, fell down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.19.eng: Making get up, making lie down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.20.eng: Death through food, death through drink.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.21.eng: Child by a lover, and co-wives;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.25.eng: Tickling, in taking hold of, a spirit,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.27.eng: Thinking it was them, he gave a blow,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.11.28.eng: In talking about heaven, and about hell.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain monk was sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.1.2.eng: Out of compassion, the monks praised death to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.1.4.pli: Tesaṃ kukkuccaṃ ahosi “bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ, kacci nu kho mayaṃ pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpannā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.1.4.eng: They became anxious and said, “The Buddha has laid down a training rule. Could it be that we’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu pīṭhake pilotikāya paṭicchannaṃ dārakaṃ nisīdanto ottharitvā māresi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.2.1.eng: On one occasion an alms-collecting monk sat down on a bench, crushing a boy who was concealed by an old cloth. The boy died.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.2.2.pli: Tassa kukkuccaṃ ahosi “bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ, kacci nu kho ahaṃ pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.2.2.eng: The monk became anxious and thought, “The Buddha has laid down a training rule. Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.2.5.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, appaṭivekkhitvā āsane nisīditabbaṃ; yo nisīdeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.2.5.eng: But you shouldn’t sit down on a seat without checking it. If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu bhattagge antaraghare āsanaṃ paññapento musale ussite ekaṃ musalaṃ aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.1.eng: On one occasion a monk was preparing a seat in a dining hall in an inhabited area. When he took hold of a pestle high up,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.2.pli: Dutiyo musalo paripatitvā aññatarassa dārakassa matthake avatthāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.2.eng: a second pestle fell down, hitting a boy,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu bhattagge antaraghare āsanaṃ paññapento udukkhalabhaṇḍikaṃ akkamitvā pavaṭṭesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.8.eng: On one occasion a monk was preparing a seat in a dining hall in an inhabited area when he forcefully kicked the implements belonging to a mortar.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.8.comm: Sp-ṭ 1.180: Udukkhalabhaṇḍikanti udukkhalatthāya ānītaṁ dārubhaṇḍaṁ, “Udukkhalabhaṇḍika: wooden goods brought for the sake of a mortar.” That akkamati can mean “kick” can be seen from Bu Pj 1:10.20.9: Aññatarā itthī passitvā aṅgajāte abhinisīdi, “The monk kicked her off.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.3.9.eng: They crushed a boy, who died.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pitāputtā bhikkhūsu pabbajitā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.1.eng: At one time a father and son had gone forth with the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.2.eng: When the time was announced for a certain event, the son said to his father,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.2.comm: “For a certain event” is not found in the Pali, but has been added to make the Pali idiom clearer. Sp 2.108: Kāle ārociteti yāgubhattādīsu yassa kassaci kāle ārocite, “Kāle ārocite: when the time is announced for whatever, such as rice porridge, a meal, etc.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.3.eng: “Go, sir, the Sangha is waiting for you,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.4.eng: and seizing him by the back, he pushed him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.8.eng: “I didn’t mean to kill him, sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.9.eng: “There’s no offense for one who isn’t aiming at death.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pitāputtā bhikkhūsu pabbajitā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.10.eng: At one time a father and son had gone forth with the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.11.eng: When the time was announced for a certain event, the son said to his father,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.12.eng: “Go, sir, the Sangha is waiting for you,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.13.eng: and seizing him by the back, he pushed him, aiming to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.16.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.17.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pitāputtā bhikkhūsu pabbajitā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.17.eng: At one time a father and son had gone forth with the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.18.eng: When the time was announced for a certain event, the son said to his father,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.19.eng: “Go, sir, the Sangha is waiting for you,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.20.eng: and seizing him by the back, he pushed him, aiming to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.21.eng: The father fell, but did not die.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno bhuñjantassa maṃsaṃ kaṇṭhe vilaggaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.1.eng: On one occasion a monk got meat stuck in his throat while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno gīvāyaṃ pahāraṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.2.eng: A second monk hit him on the neck.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.3.eng: The meat was expelled together with blood,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who isn’t aiming at death.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno bhuñjantassa maṃsaṃ kaṇṭhe vilaggaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.7.eng: On one occasion a monk got meat stuck in his throat while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.8.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo tassa bhikkhuno gīvāyaṃ pahāraṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.8.eng: Another monk hit him on the neck, aiming to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.9.eng: The meat was expelled together with blood,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.12.eng: “You have committed an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno bhuñjantassa maṃsaṃ kaṇṭhe vilaggaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.13.eng: On one occasion a monk got meat stuck in his throat while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.14.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo tassa bhikkhuno gīvāyaṃ pahāraṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.14.eng: Another monk hit him on the neck, aiming to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.15.eng: The meat was expelled together with blood,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.16.eng: but the monk did not die.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu visagataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ labhitvā paṭikkamanaṃ haritvā bhikkhūnaṃ aggakārikaṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.6.1.eng: On one occasion an alms-collecting monk received poisoned almsfood. He brought it back and gave the first portion to other monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.6.6.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t know.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.6.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vīmaṃsādhippāyo aññatarassa bhikkhuno visaṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.6.7.eng: On one occasion a monk gave poison to a second monk with the purpose of investigating it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.6.11.eng: “My purpose was to investigate it, sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū vihāravatthuṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.1.eng: On one occasion the monks of Āḷavī were preparing a site for a dwelling

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu heṭṭhā hutvā silaṃ uccāresi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.2.eng: when a monk lifted up a stone to another monk above him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.3.pli: Uparimena bhikkhunā duggahitā silā heṭṭhimassa bhikkhuno matthake avatthāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.3.eng: As the second monk did not grasp it properly, it fell on the head of the monk below,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū vihāravatthuṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.7.eng: On one occasion the monks of Āḷavī were preparing a site for a dwelling

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.8.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu heṭṭhā hutvā silaṃ uccāresi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.8.eng: when a monk lifted up a stone to another monk above him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.9.pli: Uparimo bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo heṭṭhimassa bhikkhuno matthake silaṃ muñci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.9.eng: The second monk dropped the stone on his head, aiming to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.10.comm: This is to be expanded as in segments 5.5.7–5.5.19 above.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū vihārassa kuṭṭaṃ uṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.8.1.eng: On one occasion the monks of Āḷavī were building a wall for a dwelling

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.8.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu heṭṭhā hutvā iṭṭhakaṃ uccāresi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.8.2.eng: when a monk lifted up a brick to another monk above him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.22.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six tickled a monk from the group of seventeen to make him laugh.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.22.2.eng: Being unable to catch his breath, he died.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.23.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū chabbaggiyaṃ bhikkhuṃ kammaṃ karissāmāti ottharitvā māresuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.23.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of seventeen overpowered a monk from the group of six, intending to do a legal procedure against him. He died.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.23.1.comm: The text doesn’t say what the legal procedure, the (saṅgha-)kamma, was about, but it seems implied that it was against that monk.
